intro: Zigadenus elegans, commonly known as the western white snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open woodlands and meadows. The plant features showy, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while its stems are hairy and somewhat glandular. Zigadenus elegans is toxic to both humans and animals, containing various poisonous alkaloids.
